intro: Hibbertia ovata, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant has compound leaves with oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds. Hibbertia ovata is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in arid or semi-arid environments. It is also a symbol of Australian identity and is widely cultivated for its ornamental value.
